"New Type and Old Type Weapons"

"There are two kinds of Weapons:
\u3000- \"Old Type\" Weapons
\u3000- \"New Type (NT)\" Weapons

Since Episode 4, a new system of weapons were
introduced called New Type Weapons or NT Weapons."

"For New Type Weapons, the \"Item Details\" tab, an EXP bar will be displayed. They will also sport a blue frame around the weapon icon.

※Some weapons will also have the suffix \"-NT\" which will also denote that they're a New Type Weapon."

"With New Type Weapons, they offer much better stats and performance than the Old Type Weapons.

Various enemies as well as the \"Collect File,\" drop these NT
Weapons."
"Grinding NT Weapons"
"You can upgrade weapons at the Item Lab. Upgrading allows you to customize your weapons and armor units."

"You need the following to perform an upgrade:

- A grinder
- Meseta
- Another NT Weapon
Note that they will be used up in the process of upgrading weapons and armor."
"Upgrading may succeed or it may fail. When it succeeds, item performance improves. When it fails, there is a chance that item performance may decline."
"A successful grind will display its new grind level compared to its previous grind level."

"The greater number of weapons added, the greater the EXP bonus on the success.

You can also increase the success rate by using a \"Support Item\", such as a \"Great Grind Success Rate-type\" item."

"After the weapon has been strengthened, the weapon's name will then show the grind level appended to the end of its name.

\u3000\u3000Example: \"(Weapon Name)+1\"

This denotes that the weapon has been grinded to its first level."
"Unlocking Potentials in NT Weapons"

"Just like their Old-Type counterparts, New-Type weapons also have an unlockable \"Potential Ability\".

These Potential Abilities all have a unique criteria in which they activate.

However, in order to use these abilities, New-Type weapons have to be at a certain grind condition for them to unlock as follows:

\u3000From Grind Level \"+10\" → \"+11\"
\u3000From Grind Level \"+20\" → \"+21\"
\u3000From Grind Level \"+30\" → \"+31\"

At each of these conditions, a \"Potential Ability\" will automatically unlock."
"To unlock a Potential Ability, materials components such as a \"Photon Crystal\" and Meseta are required."

"Every Potential Ability has its own level, from level 1 to level 3.

The higher the Potential Ability level, the greater the effects are."
"Grinding Attributes in NT Weapons"

"For New Type Weapons, there's \"Attribute\" and \"Attribute Value.\"

\"Attribute\" refers to your weapon's elemental type.
\"Attribute\" refers to the elemental value percentage of your
weapon."

"To increase the Attribute Value, you will need to use a material weapon via grinding the weapon itself.

For this reason, the weapon needs to be of the same rarity and
type."

"When using the same type weapon, with the same matching rarity and matching name as the target weapon, the attribute value will increase significantly.

※The value will increase even if the attributes are different in both the value and the actual elemental attributes are different.

Normal attribute values are capped at 50. However, Weapons and Eggs of ★13 in rarity have a maximum attribute value of 60."

"The higher the attribute, the more damage you deal to the enemy.

Furthermore, damage that matches an enemy's attribute weakness will result in even greater damage!

The attribute is determined when you obtain a weapon, but can be changed later with support items."
"The Overgrind Limit"

"For New-Type weapons, their grind cap is at \"+30\".

When a weapon has a grind level of \"+30\", its Potential Ability level is at \"Lv.3\" as well."

"However, you can extend this grind cap to a maximum of +35, by doing one of the following:

\u3000・Using a weapon of the same name as grind material, or
\u3000・By using a Support Item such as \"Grind Cap +1\"

※This process can be completed multiple times until the grind cap limit has reached its maximum. (Maximum grind cap +35)"
"Special Ability Factors"

"Some NT weapons will have a \"Special Ability Factor\" when their grind level reaches \"+35\".

These Special Ability Factors are unique Special Abilities that you can select when you add \"Special Abilities\"."

"You can preview what type of Special Ability Factor your weapons might have by using the \"Special Ability Factor Confirmation\" option.

※Special Ability Factors are not bound to the same type of restrictions that most regular Special Abilities face."

S-ATK, R-ATK and T-ATK
"

"There are 3 types of attack power:
S-ATK, R-ATK and T-ATK.

S-ATK affects melee attacks from striking weapons.
R-ATK affects ranged attacks from shooting weapons.
T-ATK affects attacks that use Techniques.

The higher the value of the parameter, the more damage you deal with those types of attacks."

"Also, with higher DEX, damage variance is tightened, meaning damage will be higher more consistently.

There are also 3 types of defense power:
S-DEF, R-DEF and T-DEF, each of which has the effect of reducing one type of damage.
By raising DEX, you can reduce the damage you receive."
"Attributes"

"There are 6 Attributes: Fire, Ice, Lightning, Wind, Light and Dark.

A weapon with an Attribute will deal additional damage to enemies, which will be increased even further against enemies that are weak to that Attribute."
